titleStmt.title: John Davis et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6841

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned, state, that John W Harris was indicted in the Fayette Circuit Court for maliciously stabbing with intent to kill, one James Harkins. That he was at the August term 1865 of said Court tried for said offense, and fined $250 for a misdemeanour. That we we were of the jury who tried him, and although bound in law as expounded by the court to inflict the fine yet we beleived, and now beleive from the evidence, that his case is one that would fully justify the interposition of your Excellency. Mr Harris is, as was shown by some of the most respectable men in Woodford County ^to be^ of good character, of a peaceable, and quiet disposition and industrious in his habits We would therefore respectfully ask that the prayer of his petition asking a remission of his firm so far as your Excellency can remit it, be granted

John Davis
Simon Hopper
E J Smith
J T Hughes
J L Keyes
R R Allen
Elbert
John M Farmer
W, W, Gray --
